scenario: Could you go with me to the mall today?
excuse: No because I have to go to the doctors two weeks from now.

scenario: Could you wash the debris off the roof.
excuse: But some of the debris is old.

scenario: Could you get me a new skate board?
excuse: But they have a skateboard in the store.

scenario: I am in charge of collecting payments for the lottery pool.
excuse: So I should give the office manager the lot rent money to save until I need to turn it in.

scenario: I am a housekeeper for an elderly couple.
excuse: So I should sleep in their bed.

scenario: I promised to attend a charity event tonight.
excuse: But I have suddenly fallen very ill.

scenario: Could you help set up for the party tonight?
excuse: No because I broke my leg yesterday.

scenario: Please cook dinner for the family tonight.
excuse: But there is no food in the refrigerator.

scenario: Would you mind taking out the trash?
excuse: But it is not full yet.

scenario: Can you drive me to the airport tomorrow?
excuse: No because my car broke down.

scenario: Could you pick up the dry cleaning today?
excuse: But I already picked it up yesterday.

scenario: Will you attend the staff meeting this afternoon?
excuse: No because I'm on vacation this week.

scenario: Can you cover my shift tomorrow?
excuse: But tomorrow is my own birthday.

scenario: Please call the plumber for the leaking faucet.
excuse: No because it's cheaper to fix it myself.

scenario: Could you water the plants today?
excuse: But it rained heavily this morning.

scenario: Would you mind babysitting tonight?
excuse: No, I have to study for an important exam tomorrow.

scenario: Could you mail this letter for me?
excuse: But the post office is already closed.

scenario: Please finish the report by this evening.
excuse: No, because the data hasn't arrived yet.

scenario: Would you clean the garage today?
excuse: But I cleaned it thoroughly last weekend.

scenario: Can you help me carry this furniture upstairs?
excuse: No, I injured my back last week.

scenario: Can you pick up some groceries on your way home?
excuse: No, because the grocery store is closed today.

scenario: Could you take the dog for a walk now?
excuse: But I already walked him an hour ago.

scenario: Can you come to my recital tomorrow?
excuse: No, I have a mandatory work meeting at that time.

scenario: Could you help decorate the room for the party?
excuse: But I don’t like decorating.

scenario: Please prepare the documents for tomorrow's meeting.
excuse: But my printer ran out of ink.

scenario: Could you please refill the bird feeder?
excuse: But the birds didn't finish the food yet.

scenario: Could you please proofread my essay tonight?
excuse: No because I have poor grammar skills.

scenario: Can you join the group project discussion today?
excuse: But I just don’t want to.

scenario: Could you please help clean up after dinner?
excuse: No, I have to make an urgent phone call.

scenario: Would you mind running an errand for me today?
excuse: No because I have to pick up my child from school.

scenario: Could you mow the lawn today?
excuse: No, it's raining heavily outside.

scenario: Would you mind checking my mail while I'm away?
excuse: No because your mailbox key doesn't work.

scenario: Can you deliver these papers across town today?
excuse: But the roads are blocked due to construction.

scenario: Could you bake a cake for the office party?
excuse: No, I'm allergic to flour.

scenario: Would you mind cleaning the windows?
excuse: No because they will get dirty again.

scenario: Could you assist the customers at the front desk?
excuse: No, I’m scheduled for my break now.

scenario: Can you fix my computer today?
excuse: But I don't know anything about computers.

scenario: Would you mind babysitting my kids tonight?
excuse: No, I don't like children.

scenario: Could you return these library books today?
excuse: No, because the library is already closed.

scenario: Can you take notes during today's meeting?
excuse: No, I forgot my notebook and laptop.

scenario: Could you help me move this weekend?
excuse: No, because I have family visiting from out of town.

scenario: Can you drive me to work today?
excuse: No, because your workplace is too far.

scenario: Could you help set the dinner table tonight?
excuse: But it's not dinner time yet.

scenario: Would you mind washing the dishes?
excuse: No, my hands are injured.

scenario: Could you lend me your car today?
excuse: No, I need it for my own errands today.

scenario: Can you join us for dinner tonight?
excuse: No, I’m not hungry right now.

scenario: Could you organize the files before the audit?
excuse: No, because the files are already organized.

scenario: Would you mind painting the fence today?
excuse: But the paintbrushes are missing.

scenario: Can you pick up my medication from the pharmacy?
excuse: No, the pharmacy is closed today.

scenario: Could you finish this task by tomorrow?
excuse: No, because I don't feel like working today.
